attributes.action: UK Government to raise the murder of Carl Davies with the Government of France
attributes.background: In 2011 a former Royal Marine working in Maritime Security called Carl Davies was murdered on the French Island of Reunion in the Indian Ocean. The Reunion authorities have still to date not brought Carl's murderers to justice and the family need some form of closure regarding the death of Carl.

attributes.action: All halal and kosher meat to be labelled with method of production and slaughter
attributes.background: The UK invoked the religious exemption from the EU's slaughter directive 2009. More halal slaughter is carried out in the UK than in the rest of Europe. We eat halal meat unwittingly in schools, planes, hospitals and buy it from outlets and supermarkets as it is sold without being labelled as such.
attributes.additional_details: Compulsory labelling would allow informed consumer choice and reduce conflict with other religious groups' preferences. Labelling must apply to 100% of the product and by-product of any ritually slaughtered animal or bird. The hindquarters of an animal are regarded as non-Halal even if the Halal method of slaughter was used so labelling must be precise. All imported meats and by-products should also be clearly labelled to show country of origin, method of production and transport, and slaughter.

attributes.action: UK Government should urge Iran, Iraq and Turkey to lift blockade on Kurdistan.
attributes.background: In retaliation to an overwhelmingly YES vote for independence by the Kurds in the recent referendum, the Iraqi Government, Turkey & Iran are to impose a blockade on Kurdistan. If enforced, such a blockade will hamper the fight against ISIS and cause a real humanitarian crisis in the region.
attributes.additional_details: When the entire world woke up to witness ISIS sweeping across Syria and Iraq slaughtering thousands in 2014, it was the Kurd who took up the fight on behalf of the world and broke the myth of the so called “death cult” on the ground, whilst holding fast to the universal values and human rights by giving refuge to almost 2 million displaced Iraqis and Syrian within its territories. A semi-autonomous Kurdistan has been a source for stability and peace in Iraq; an independent Kurdistan will most certainly be a greater force for peace and stability in the wider region. We, the undersigned, call upon the UK Government to utilise its diplomatic means to exert pressure on these countries to stop the BLOCKADE resulting in yet another humanitarian crisis in Kurdistan and the wider region.

attributes.action: Improve Availability of NHS Services for FND Sufferers
attributes.background: Functional Neurological Disorder sufferers are often left with limited & insufficient treatment options. Treatment requires a team of neurologists, physiotherapists etc. which must be integrated to create an effective plan. Currently, services are not equipped for this kind of specialist care.
attributes.additional_details: Up to 1/3 of all neurological referrals are diagnosed with FND. Sufferers end up relinquishing their independence & become reliant on a carer.  They are left unable to function & it’s vital we improve prospects. Medically Unexplained Symptoms (including FND) directly cost the NHS approximately £3.1 billion, with an additional £18 billion in indirect costs. With an NHS already under pressure, improving services and treatment for those with FND would greatly lift this burden.

attributes.action: Hold a general election within the next 3 months.
attributes.background: The current government is dysfunctional. Current policies ranging from NHS and social care to Brexit are causing great dismay. This country deserves better. The current government refuses to contribute to parliamentary votes, uses filibustering tactics and lacks transparency. This is not democracy.

attributes.action: Review the share of Government money spent on Northamptonshire services
attributes.background:
Several ​le​ss-deprived counties ​get much more spent on them per head than​ Northamptonshire​, mainly due to an out-of-date funding model​.

We need a fairer allocation scheme to better reflect today’s population growth and levels of deprivation in Northamptonshire.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to properly fund our roads, child social care, police, NHS and fire service and look after our elderly people. All of these are falling further behind other counties every year.

Surrey gets £134 more per person​ this year despite being considerably ​less needy, according to Government statistics.

The Local Government Association says Northamptonshire is the county least able to fund itself in the future.

attributes.action: Change the law on Cross Border Hire of taxis and private hire vehicles.
attributes.background: Nationally in the UK thousands of drivers are exploiting the sub-contracting clause in the Deregulation Act 2015(section 55).This has allowed the situation whereby a person licensed in one authority can work as a PHV in any other authority in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
A good example of this exploitation would be; if a person took, and failed, a Knowledge test in one of the 316 Licensing authorities in the UK. This person could then choose to take a Knowledge Test in an authority with far fewer roads to learn, pass the test with ease, and then go back to work in the area they had originally failed in. 
The rise in drivers working for "app based" companies has seen the situation where drivers licensed in London are working in different authorities nationwide.

attributes.action: Exempt kinship care households from the 2 child restriction on child tax credit
attributes.background: There are around 200,000 children being raised by kinship carers across the UK. Kinship carers are grandparents, older siblings and other relatives and friends who step in to care for children, many of whom would otherwise be in the care system.
attributes.additional_details: 49% of kinship carers have to give up work to take on the children (Family Rights Group Survey). This often pushes the household into poverty. Some kinship carers are being hit by the new child tax credit limit. Kinship carers already raising two children can't now claim child tax credit for any baby to whom they then give birth. This penalises, for example, young women raising their teenage siblings following their parents' death, who now can't claim child tax credit for their own baby.

attributes.action: Increase compulsory school age to 7
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest compulsory school ages in the world, and yet is behind other countries academically. Starting school at age 4 has a negative impact on children's education often leading to children being labelled with having additional needs when in reality they are simply not ready.

attributes.action: Extend the 'Recall of MPs Act 2015'
attributes.background:
The Recall of MPs Act 2015 needs to be extended so that those MPs who go against the will of their own constituents can be recalled.

How can it be a representative democracy if our MPs are allowed to go against the will of the people who elect them to represent them?
attributes.additional_details: Failing to represent those who elect them is as much a travesty as any of the current reasons given for calling for a Recall of any of our elected representatives but at this time the Recall of MPs Act 2015 does not cover such an eventuality and those signing this petition feel that it should.

attributes.action: make it a legal requirement that all hunting dogs on a hunt should be muzzled.
attributes.background:
Hounds are killing foxes on trail and drag hunts. Where they may follow a live fox scent or come across a fox.
They are also on occasions attacking pet dogs and other wildlife.
They can be very intimidating to general public also.
By having these hunting dogs muzzled would prevent any incidents.

attributes.action: Introduce rules requiring coroners to respect Jewish and Muslim religious laws
attributes.background: A vice president of the Board of Deputies of British Jews has said that a North London Coroner shows “no inclination” to address Jewish concerns. Under Jewish & Islamic law, bodies must be buried quickly and invasive postmortems are a desecration. The Board wants this coroner dismissed.
attributes.additional_details:
The Chief Rabbi has written to the Lord Chancellor. Here are extracts.
 
.....concern had grown over recent years about the failure of [the coroner] ... to give due regard to the deeply held religious beliefs of Jewish and indeed Muslim families ...
 
... Where the fastest possible burial is denied ...it can cause a great deal of pain at a time when they are already grieving.
 
...there are no other coroners .. who have taken such a stance.

attributes.action: Return Scottish devolved powers to UK Government and Parliament
attributes.background: Devolved Powers have not delivered real benefit to the people of Scotland and Many people are disillusioned by the Government and constant demands for Independence Referendums.

attributes.action: Change the law in England to "opt out" for organ donations
attributes.background: In England, Scotland and Northern Ireland, your organs and tissue will only be used if you have given consent.  Wales changed to "opt out" in 2015 and Scotland is considering it.  England and NI rely on public awareness campaigns.
attributes.additional_details: In the first six months after the law change, there was a 38% reduction in the number of people in Wales waiting for a transplant.  Just 36% of people in the UK are now on the NHS Organ Donor Register, compared with 30% five years ago.  According to a recent BBC article http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-40564329  457 people died last year while on the waiting list, as they did not get a donor organ in time.  875 people became too ill to undergo transplant surgery.

attributes.action: Automatic Settlement Rights to the Elderly Parents of the British Citizens
attributes.background: Elderly parents/relatives should be given an automatic right to settle in the UK subject to their UK family’s ability to maintain and accommodate them without recourse to the public funds.
attributes.additional_details: In the past few years, the immigration rules have made it virtually impossible for the elderly dependent parents/relatives of the British citizen to settle in the UK. This has led to the elderly parents forced to leave the UK and/or refusal of their entry clearance application resulting them living alone without the vital physical and emotional support. A change in the law is well overdue to make sure that they live with the dignity that they deserve in the most vulnerable years of their lives with their loved ones.

attributes.action: Reverse government decision that will increase State Pension Age for millions
attributes.background: When State Pension Age (SPA) is reviewed, the underlying principle is that the proportion of adult life spent over SPA should be constant. At first the target proportion was up to 33.3%. Government now wants to reduce this to 32%. The 33.3% target must be maintained or SPA will rise for millions.
attributes.additional_details:
The principle of "up to one third" of adult life over State Pension Age (SPA) was announced in the 2013 Autumn Statement.

But in July the Secretary of State said "Government is minded to commit to ‘up to 32%’ as the right proportion”.

Under the original principle, SPA reaches 68 by April 2041 and 69 by April 2055. Under the new approach it would be 11 and 13 years earlier respectively and 70 by April 2056.

Unless the original target is retained, millions of people will have a higher SPA.

attributes.action: Stop the unfair electoral boundary changes!
attributes.background:
There's currently a plan to reduce the number of MP's by "revising" the electoral boundaries (MP constituency seats).
The changes are not fair. More power will go to the remaining MP's & this is scary. We will permanently lose 50 MP's which will mean our votes matter less. Stop the changes.
attributes.additional_details:
If we have 50 less MP's, those new MP's who take over a neighbouring constituency will have more emails and more letters which they will probably not respond to. We'll have less chances to speak to our MP's. It will also mean less representation in Parliament for the British Public.The population needs proper representation.

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/oct/17/boundary-changes-house-of-commons-mps-ministers-plans
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerrymandering

attributes.action: Bring forward the order for the Red Arrows Hawk Jets with BAE Systems
attributes.background: Let’s get backing both the future of The Red Arrows and a great British company; BAE Systems.The Red Arrows; an iconic British treasure which means so much more than money and politics. We need to show the government how much we need to promote national pride in these uncertain times.
attributes.additional_details: The time to act is NOW, BAE Systems is in need of immediate short term stability and the current Red Arrows aircraft only have a limited number of years left before they will be de-commissioned.

attributes.action: Declare the 2016 referendum vote null and void due to foreign interference
attributes.background: It is clear now that foreign influence and inaccurate facts were highly influential on the electorate during the Brexit referendum and therefore the result should be declared as null and void.

attributes.action: Guarantee the UK will not introduce Welfare Cards
attributes.background: We the undersigned ask the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions to guarantee that they will prevent any introduction of Welfare Cards and the removal of choice for claimants of Social Security.
attributes.additional_details:
This would only induce further stigmatisation of claimants leading to a failure to the ‘right to live’ (Article 8 & Article 14 HRA) as others in the UK currently enjoy who are employed. 

Many claimants who have paid into the welfare state over their years of work life have found themselves out of work or sick or disabled. This would be social engineering, forcing them to buy goods from government sanctioned suppliers when in many cases goods can be bought cheaper elsewhere.

attributes.action: Make Autistic Spectrum Disorder widely known about within the DWP Assessments.
attributes.background: Regardless of where on the Autistic Spectrum an individual is, low or high functioning, they are similar but all have different needs. The biggest problem all ASD sufferers have in common is social and communication skills.
attributes.additional_details: It's a condition that one is born with and it will never not be there. There isn't medication to lessen the symptoms of Autism or to control them. There is a lack of education with the very people we put our trust in. The DWP response to a Freedom of Information (FOI) request stated 80% of Mandatory reconsiderations are rejected as performance indicators. That's almost 9 out of 10 people! There is much needed information being missed out in assessments where invisible illnesses are concerned.

attributes.action: Debate effect of pumping out brine at Fleetwood on marine life and livelihoods
attributes.background: Consent has been given for brine to be pumped out at Fleetwood.  Pumping will continue for years, whilst they build underground gas storage caverns. Local experts have concerns about the possible effects on our delicate marine ecology and on local livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details:
There are concerns relating to conservation; the food chain; fishing industry; tourism; polluted water from Fleetwood dock; and the accuracy of dispersal modelling.

We call for a parliamentary debate on the brine discharge and on whether the benefits of this project for the UK outweigh the possible negative impacts on the local area.

attributes.action: Make Houses of Parliament alcohol free.
attributes.background: The issue of sexual harassment at work is a matter of concern, not least within Parliament. We believe Parliament should lead the way in ending this abuse. Many complaints are reported to arise in situations where alcohol is involved. Parliament is a place of work and there is no need for alcohol.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1293902/MPs-drunk-hour-drinking-session-voted-Budget.html The culture of drinking within the Houses of Parliament is a national disgrace. Ending the sale of alcohol, both at bars and with meals, would not only help reduce sexual harassment, but help members stay alert and able to conduct business on behalf of the tax payer. Parliament is a place of work, and there is no need for alcohol to be served.

attributes.action: Call for a British Government apology for the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre of 1919
attributes.background: In 1919 Colonel Dyer ordered his men to fire, and maybe 1,000 peaceful protesters were left dead. At the time Winston Churchill proclaimed the massacre "monstrous" and the British Government condemned Dyer for his actions, but no apology has since been forthcoming. It is now time to apologise.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any MP to lie in parliament or knowingly deceive the public.
attributes.background: Repeal Parliamentary Privilege and reform Contempt of Parliament to make it illegal for MPs to lie or knowingly deceive the public in the execution of their duties. This must include campaigning and all statements made in Parliament or the media. Breach of this condition must trigger a by-election.
attributes.additional_details: It should be a legal offence in the UK, as it is in some other countries and nations, to lie, wilfully mislead or knowingly deceive the public in execution of ones duties or whilst occupying a public office. This should include, but not be limited to; campaigning, liasing with the media or in any public forum. This should be covered by 'Misconduct in Public Office'. A breach of such conditions should result in dismissal from office, or at the very least a by-election for the seat in question.

attributes.action: Rule out UK government joining the US in future involvement against North Korea.
attributes.background: The British Government has refused to rule out joining its US ally in using military force against North Korea. We, the British public, must be promised that the UK will not join the US in military aggressions against N. Korea. It will cost millions of lives and leave our nation in financial ruin.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Government has refused to rule out joining its US ally in using military force against North Korea after Donald Trump threatened to totally destroy the rogue state if attacked.

http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/joining-united-states-in-military-action-against-north-korea-a-possibility-downing-street-says/ar-AAsemmO?ocid=sf


http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/847490/china-north-korea-outrageous-missile-blast-japan-theresa-may

attributes.action: Stop killing badgers
attributes.background: Bovine TB is spread in other ways, not just by badgers. Science does not support the continued killing of badgers. This cull is unfounded and must stop. Why should cows be more important than badgers anyway? Protecting businesses before wildlife.

attributes.action: Make companies legally obliged to pay mandatory breaks for professional drivers
attributes.background:
LGV and PCV Drivers are legally obliged to take unpaid breaks at very specific times, and can be fined, prosecuted or contracts terminated if they fail to do so.
Despite being unpaid, the drivers responsibility for the vehicle and load still remain, just so long as they are officially “not working”
attributes.additional_details:
It’s considered that a break is time off of work but for a professional Driver this is not the case. When stopping for a break the best scenario they can hope for is to be at a services. Not ideal but when considered that drivers also have to stop in lay-bys at small roads, it neither desirable or relaxing
In a 10 hour day, a Driver will typically be deducted 45mins pay because of his mandatory breaks, when they have barely left the place of work for even a few minutes

attributes.action: Ban attendance awards in schools
attributes.background:
BAN ATTENDANCE AWARDS
Those are:
-       Highly discriminatory
-       Promote inequality
-       Highly unfair
-       Encourage bullying
-       Force parents to send poorly children to school which puts at risk
children with weaker immune system
attributes.additional_details:
Attendance awards are the proof that DfE has no regard to section 149 Equality Act 2010. Attendance schemes promote inequality, children with disabilities do not have as high chances to receive the school award as children with good health. 
Those are:
-       Highly discriminatory
-       Promote inequality
-       Highly unfair
-       Encourage bullying
-       Force parents to send poorly children to school which puts at risk children with weaker immune system

attributes.action: Hold a General Election if the Government  avoids an Opposition Day vote again.
attributes.background:
Government abstained from the Opposition Day vote on Universal Credit (18/10/17), insulting both democracy & Parliament.

In the words of John Bercow: “This institution is bigger than any one party & is bigger than any government”

If the Government doesn’t respect this then we must replace it.

attributes.action: I would like all military veterans to receive free train travel in the UK
attributes.background:
To support current military veterans and homeless veterans with free travel on trains within the UK to support with social, mental welfare and support.
Reducing stress, anxiety and the chance to mix with likeminded persons who may also be suffering with issues from leaving the services.
attributes.additional_details: Currently veterans will meet annually to mix with old comrades and to get the feeling of support that we don’t feel we get from our normal lives. The people missing from these events are the homeless Vets and PTSD suffers who struggle on a daily basis. I see this as an area that other Vets can support struggling veterans with one to one meetings or planned events. This could reduce suicides and reduce strains on the NHS. The number of travel could be set minimum of 3 per year.

attributes.action: Make desecration of war memorials and symbols of remembrance a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
War memorials were constructed at the center of towns and villages so that people could be reminded of the sacrifices made by brave men and women who died to preserve our freedom.
Poppies and other items are placed at these memorials to ensure we do not forget those sacrifices.
attributes.additional_details:
There are now too many instances of people that think it is in order to desecrate these memorials, poppies and other items which are there to remind us of a debt owed to the many that gave their lives so that we could be free.
Desecrating of war memorials, items purchased and placed on these memorials are to be respected.
Whatever political, religious or ethnic issues people may have, their argument cannot be with the fallen heroes of another generation.

attributes.action: Regulate land management companies: cap charges and increase transparency
attributes.background: Cap land maintenance price increases at the same rate as inflation to stop large price increases (we had nearly 30% this year); require management fees to be fixed in contracts, to stop extra fees; and require invoices for extra charges to prove works are carried out and not to be excessive.
attributes.additional_details: I live on an estate which has green areas owned by a company which charges home owners for maintaining this land. They charge for works with no proof of work being carried out. This year they raised the price by 29.4% per month raising the price by £53.18 a month, costing an extra £638.16 per year! The company do not carry out the agreed works properly and demand payments or legal action will be taken against home owners for non-payment. The company also do not deal with complaints efficiently.

attributes.action: Recognise nonbinary people in law
attributes.background: We call on the government to recognise nonbinary people in law as distinct from men and women, in the form of a third gender option on passports and birth certificates, the ability to change one's gender legally to a third option with a gender recognition certificate as trans men and women can, etc.
attributes.additional_details: The best estimate we have is that around 0.4% of people are nonbinary (EHRC), over 250,000 people in the UK, comparable to the number of Buddhists in the UK - yet we are not counted in the UK census. We are not protected by the Equality Act unless someone thinks we're trans, we are required to pretend to be men or women when getting married, companies are not required to provide toilets or changing rooms for us, when we're in prison we share it with people whose genders differ from our own.

attributes.action: Enshrine in law that foreign nationals hold medical insurance before entry to UK
attributes.background: The NHS is free at point of contact for all. Foreign Nationals often use the NHS then leave the country without paying for treatment. I therfore petition parliament to enshrine in law that ALL Foreigners should hold medical insurance and must prove that they hold this before entering the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The UK needs to look after the NHS and nurture it. We have the finest health care system in the world. But it can no longer cope with the influx and lack of funding. Making sure that foreign nationals have health insurance before they enter the UK will help elevate some of the funding issues the NHS currently has. It will also eliminate health tourism and free up appointments that are much needed for UK Nationals.

attributes.action: Ban animal testing (vivisection) in the UK completely
attributes.background: With the new advanced technology we have today we can now replace the use of animals in testing labs. Over 160,000 people still die every year by using drugs that have tested 'safe' on animals which proves the results are inaccurate.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year in the UK (not including Northern Ireland) Around 4 million procedures take place on animals such as Dogs, horses, mice, rats, cats, rabbits, primates and guinea pigs. 
Lab animals are left to suffer with no pain relief during the course of the experiment which can, at times last for weeks before they are killed. 
We now have technology that can replace this and end the cruelty and suffering of millions of animals per year saving both humans and animals.

attributes.action: Make Parental Alienation a Criminal act that can carry a custodial sentence.
attributes.background: If a Parent, Grandparent, Guardian, Relative or Organisation that is stopping a child from seeing their biological parents or parents on their birth certificate, without a lawful reason (Child safety with formal proof) should be given a custodial sentence, like Brazil.
attributes.additional_details: The Case Of John William Greer Vs Pauline Hutchinson and Larne First Serve Community Social Services (1997) - Father when to court to gain custody after being denied access to his son.

attributes.action: Protect UK Citizens' existing Freedom of Movement rights in Brexit negotiations
attributes.background: The UK Passport gives us, as EU Citizens, the Right to live and work in 28 EU Countries (& 3 EEA Countries). As UK Citizens, we do not want to lose this Right and ask that our Rights are fully protected and that they are valued and considered in any Brexit negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
The Big EU Passport campaign was started in order to highlight the fact that the Freedom of Movement Rights of UK Citizens, who are currently EU Citizens, are not being prioritised in Brexit negotiations yet we currently have the Right to live and work in 31 countries.
 
Many people use this right in order to work in mainland EU yet live in the UK. Others want to maintain family connections.

For information about our campaign: http://breakingbrexit.blogspot.co.uk/2017/06/big-eu-passport.html

attributes.action: Full labelling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients or use in production
attributes.background: Full labelling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients e.g. animal fat in fabric softener and isinglass (swim bladder of fish) in wine production.  A simple label that there IS or IS NOT any animal ingredient or derivative used at any stage of manufacture without constantly searching the internet.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like it made mandatory that all products ie, tyre, decorating materials, household cleaners, garden products, clothes and footwear, to be clearly marked that they contain animal derivatives such as gelatin, animal based glues, and shellac.  In other words, everything that is sold in the UK. The Co-op already state on the front of their cleaning products etc. whether there is no animal ingredients.
Many items marked cruelty free still contain animal ingredients which causes confusion.

attributes.action: Provide women's health physio to all post natal woman for pelvic health advice.
attributes.background: I gave birth at the end of last year to my second child and was shocked by a letter from my GP saying unless I had "persistent bleeding/pain or wanted contraception" a routine 6 weeks check up was not required. This left me with no checks post major abdominal surgery which is very worrying.
attributes.additional_details: Women's health physios are perfect professionals for assessing, and treating the mother post natally. They can check many concerns like scar tissue healing, gynae health and abdominal separation issues. Sadly mothers are being left without anyone to talk to about incontinence, prolapse,diastasis recti problems and all of these can be prevented or at least symptoms managed to avoid surgery further down the line. Providing care at this stage will save the NHS money in the long run.

attributes.action: Stop oversized and hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel
attributes.background: We’re a logistics business headquartered in Dartford and we’ve officially had enough of the Dartford traffic jam. Our simple solution: Stop oversized & hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose a simple solution: Stop the Convoys and get Dartford moving. Traffic at the Dartford Tunnel is brought to a standstill on average 100 times a day by a small number of oversized & hazardous goods vehicles which need to be escorted through the tunnel, in a convoy. 
Each convoy can take up to 2.5 mins to travel through the tunnel, and a tunnel is closed around every 15 mins. 
Why should 99% of drivers suffer due to less than 1% of vehicles? 
Our suggestion is simple: Stop these oversized/hazardous vehicles using the tunnel & send them the other way around the M25.

attributes.action: Enshrine in law that on 29 March 2019 at 23:00 the NHS gets an extra 350million.
attributes.background: The British people voted on the 23rd June 2016 to give the NHS an extra £350million per week. This is the will of the British people and we will not tolerate any attempt to block this via the back door. Many of the people making this promise are in government today, and must be held to account.
attributes.additional_details:
Current members of the cabinet made this promise very clearly and in exit polls this was given as one of the main reasons for voting to leave the EU.

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/tony-blair-theresa-may-win-general-election-jeremy-corbyn-labour-leader-uk-prime-minister-a7705026.html

attributes.action: Make General Dental Council (GDC) a tax-payer funded organisation.
attributes.background:
The General Dental Councils remit is to work for patients whilst working with dentists.
It is now time for the funding of this body to be reviewed and for it to be paid for out of general taxation.

attributes.action: Cancel South Western Railway’s contract & to investigate their mismanagement.
attributes.background:
South Western Railway was awarded the South Western franchise in March 2017, & took over from South West Trains on the 20th August. SWT had managed the franchise for nearly 20 years.

Since the takeover, the number of delays have increased, delays have got longer, & cancellations have increased.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should investigate why the franchise has significantly worsensed since it changed hands, & why it changed during the Waterloo upgrade. Why is the service worse after the upgrade?

Need to compare the % of delayed trains now with the amount of delayed trains SWT’s had. Also stats for the length of delays, as well as the % of cancelled trains. Not just overal stats either, peak times/rush hour stats need to be anyalsed.

The government needs to consider cancelling SWR’s contract.

attributes.action: To allow psv Licence holders to upgrade free to a class 2 lorry licence.
attributes.background: As a psv driver, you are driving vehicles that are longer than a class 2 lorry. And busses can weigh a lot more than a lorry as well. With a bus you are carrying precious cargo (passengers) so why can you not allow a psv licence holder to be allowed an automatic right to a class 2 licence.
attributes.additional_details: There is a huge shortage of hgv drivers within the UK. So surely by allowing a psv licence holder the right to a class 2 lorry licence, without the need of a further driving exam would make a lot of sense.

attributes.action: Make Helmet Therapy for Babies free on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Helmet therapy is for babies who suffer from Plagiocephaly or Bracheycephaly (flat head syndrome).
This can be developed in the first few months of the baby being born due to favouring sleeping on the one side or one way causing the skull to loose shape, and also causing facial deformities.
attributes.additional_details:
This treatment has been proven to work with a positive, visual outcome in all babies that go through Helmet Therapy around the world!  It's currently not available on the NHS forcing parents to pay over £2,000 for the treatment on their own.
I have a 7 month old son going through Helmet Therapy and the results already are dramatic! Most parents can not afford this and really don't understand why it is not available on the NHS? Helmet therapy does work and needs more awareness raised!

attributes.action: Introduce a national awareness day specifically against plastic in our seas.
attributes.background: People are increasingly aware of how plastic, in all forms, is endangering sea and marine life. It doesn’t decay, possibly for centuries and we’re adding millions of new tons every year. Soon there will be more plastic than life in the sea.
attributes.additional_details: A National Awareness Day is the answer; a day on which all anti-plastic in the sea organisations and individuals could come together to maximise awareness. Britain’s ties to the sea are strong (historical, cultural, economic, geographic) and it would be great if our Government was the first to announce such a national day. Having a National Awareness Day is a win, win, win; for the oceans, people and politicians. There is currently no anti plastic in the sea day, we need one.

attributes.action: Debate: The EU referendum is now invalid due to demographic changes over time.
attributes.background: 1.2m people made up the leave majority. 600,000 uk people die each year, the same join the electorate. 2/3 of older voters are leavers. 2/3 of younger voters are remainders. The referendum is valid for a short time only before it ceases to represent the will of the people.

attributes.action: UK retailers to label all meat non-halal or halal so all religions have a choice
attributes.background: We want clearer labelling on all meat, including chicken. As most British meat does not state whether the meat is halal or non halal(haram). We want meat clearly labelled for all faiths and ethical backgrounds. So Christians, Muslim, Jewish, Sikh, etc should all have a choice in what meat they eat.
attributes.additional_details: We know people of all faiths, and have problems finding out whether the meat is non-halal or halal, as there is nothing stated on the packaging in British supermarkets/butchers. We think it is only fair that everyone of every faith should know which way the meat is slaughtered so everyone has a choice in what they are eating. There are no guidelines for consumers in making this choice for all ethical reasons. We want to see clearer labelling on every meat and chicken product sold in the UK.

attributes.action: Rule that freeholders must cover safety related costs of their buildings
attributes.background: On June 14 2017, 71 people saw there lives cut short after the Grenfell Tower was destroyed by fire, and all survivors have seen their lives hopelessly changed. The same type of cladding, which played a key role in the tragedy by allowing the fire to spread, has been found on more than 250 blocks.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaseholders of many private blocks are being charged for all implemented measures, even though Sajid Javid, DCLG Secretary urged owners/management companies not to do so. Replacement works worth £millions won't start until funds are in place, endangering lives. 

Let’s join together to ask Government to rule formally that freeholders are responsible for costs of ensuring the safety of our buildings and provide economic support to guarantee prompt implementation of whatever measures needed.
